rows.text: "She's giving me the evil eye, suck Satan's cock."

"...your enamel / made no reflection in our mirror / coughing up the coffins / cotton candy coated teeth / these pockets were clinching all filled with teeth / amnesia proletariat / in the unlikely event / that sarcasm is an unfitting dress / amnesia proletariat / amnesia proletariat / amnesia / coughing up the coffins / cotton candy coated teeth / these pockets were clinching / all filled with teeth / sharpened on the fucking hides of men..."
Heard by reversing the song starting at the 94-second mark. The message is composed of rearranged verses from earlier in the song.
"I buried my parakeet in the backyard. Oh no, you're playing the record backwards. Watch out, you might ruin your needle."
"...the sun shines. Raaain. When the rain comes, they run and hide their heads"
"Soy un perdedor. I'm a loser, baby, so why don't you kill me" (entire chorus reversed)
After the last time Beck says "I'm a loser, baby, so why don't you kill me," and before the vocal "I'm a driver, I'm a winner."
"You must wait for the rest of the non-believers/If you disagree, you will sleep/You must wait for the rest of the non-believers"
At 3 minutes and 17 seconds into the song, you can hear faint vocals that sound like gibberish. Reversed you can hear the lyrics.
"A god with hooves, a god with horns"
Clearly audible close to the second minute mark.
In the sentence "Although not a follower of David Koresh, she's a devoted Branch Davidian." The rest of the sentence is not backmasked.

"Herzlichen Glückwunsch. Muss 'ne Menge Arbeit gewesen sein, dieses Lied rückwärts abzuspielen. Entweder du bist eines der paranoiden Arschlöcher, für die wir dieses Lied gemacht haben, oder du bist einfach nur neugierig. Ersteren sei gesagt: Wer rückwärts gesprochene satanistische oder faschistische Botschaften auf unseren Platten sucht, muss ausgesprochen dämlich sein und außerdem unter extremem Verfolgungswahn leiden. Armes Schwein, du tust uns echt leid. Sperr' dich ein und schmeiß den Schlüssel weg!" (translated) Congratulations. It must have taken a lot of work to play this song backwards. Either you're one of the paranoid assholes for whom we made this song, or you're just curious. First it ought to be said that if you're looking for satanic or fascist messages played backwards on our records, you must be quite stupid and also suffer from extreme paranoia. Poor bastard, we are quite sorry for you. Lock yourself up and throw away the key!

A journalist from the daily newspaper "Darmstädter Echo" believed they had found a scandal, when they saw that title of one of the Onkelz' songs, which in their opinion is to read backwards as "Arier On" . In fact, the song title isn't Noreira but Noreia, the name of a Celtic god. In reaction of this and other witchhunts, the band released a song on the "E.I.N.S." Album called "Enie Tfahcstob rüf ediona-RAP" - backwards "Eine Botschaft für Paranoide" (A message for the paranoid). This features Stephan Weidner speaking backwards a message, which can be heard if the song is played in reverse.
"I don't mind the sun sometimes; the images it shows. You never know just how you look through other people's eyes."
Between the second chorus and the third verse.
This occurs after the song ends (about 3:06 of the track).
"How does it feel to know that you've taken someone's smile?"
Reversal of undeciperable gibberish at beginning of song.
The very end of this song wraps up a theme from the beginning in which "Mary" recites the Hail Mary. The recitation is quite obviously backmasked given the sound and length of the reversed version.
"When the gods want to punish you, they answer your prayers..."
Heard at the very end of the song.
Heard at the very start of the song (reversed).
Backwards readings of the Lord's Prayer are allegedly used in certain demonic rites.
"Buy this album now. When it gets to the end."
Has often been confused with the official release of "Lucifer" by Jay-Z. Intentionally backmasked when remixed by Danger Mouse.
"In the name of God, let the churches burn."
At the end of the track.
Occurs at the beginning of the song before the first verse.
"We are fighting with the gods of war"
From the song "Heaven Is", recorded backwards.
At the beginning of the track, accompanied by bleating of sheep. Effectively the same as the chorus.
"Ladies and gentlemen, tell me what you believe"
A reversal of earlier parts of the song. Drummer Mike Luce said, "It's just a homage. A tribute back to the old school."
"You can fuck yourself with your atom bomb."
"The music is reversible, but time... (violin note) is not. Turn back! Turn back! Turn back! Turn back!"
Reversal of a mysterious deep mumbling. Another response to the Eldorado controversy.
"Though you ride on the wheels of tomorrow, you still wander the fields of your sorrow"
Heard at the end of both songs. This was also the chorus to "21st Century Man" and "Epilogue", both from the same album.

"Welcome to the show" (2x), "Thank you for listening", "Look out there's danger ahead", "Hup two three four", "Time after time", "You're playing me backwards", "Plant a tree" and "..acquire... It's seriously gonna be fun"

This concept album, released by ELO in 1983, contains many backwards and hidden messages, both visual and auditory. It was a further response to the Satanic backmasking controversy. The British release contains a parody warning label about the backward messages, but this was deleted by CBS Records for the United States version.
"I put my thing down, flip it, and reverse it." and "Watch the way Missy like to take it backwards"
Reversed version of the preceding line. The "Watch the way Missy like to take it backwards" message can be heard in the middle of the second verse.
"I'm not here to save you / I'm only here for the ride / So let me entertain you / And everything will be fine."
At the end of the track.

"I miss my family can't live with things I've lost. The more I lie, the windiness. My open arms, the devil fell. I'm still good yeah I'm still good. Hey I'm you're friend hey I'm you're friend. It hurts again it hurts again. And you're fine, and you're fine."
The message is the reversed chorus of the hit single Not Afraid. The whole song is full of hidden messages.
While this track does contain some forward vocals as well, the entire track contains backmasking from the first (self-titled) track of the album, "Le Roi Est Mort, Vive le Roi!".
Lyrics beginning with "Cause we are the fighters / Just fighting for our rights / Stand up, join us, modern crusaders alive / We have the power"
Sections of Andru Donalds' reversed vocals from "Modern Crusaders", an earlier track in the album.
First heard at 0:10 seconds into the song and repeated throughout in various spots.
"I enjoyed making the record, very good, very good"
At the end of the song, after some seconds of silence.
"Ooh what a hell of a price, what a hell of a price."
This part is most clear for the first 1:30 of the song. Taken from the song "World Today" which segues into the next track.
"Warmer than the sun, cooler than the air."
Heard at the very end of the song at the 10:20 mark.
Heard at the very beginning of the song.
"Praise Jesus Christ. Do everything the Bible tells you to. Love thy neighbor. Do not hurt anybody."
In a song analyzing the role of God and the Devil, Francis satirizes Satanic backmasking by backmasking core Christian values.
"She's worried about you, call your mother."

Right before the second verse. A reference to bassist Bob Hardy's homesickness during the recording of the album. The band "wanted to do the exact opposite [of Satanic backmasking], put the most positive thing we could think of as a backwards message."
"One thing is for sure - the sheep is not a creature of the air. Baaaaaaaah!"
"I've been walking 'cross vast empty spaces I feel / I've been looking for one place I know that is real."
Heard at the beginning of the track before the music starts.
Found at 0:24-0:25 of the song, both phrases overlapping each other.
"No time for thinking 'bout the past. It's justice 'till you try to stay in the mirror of the time. I'm tired of living and feared of dying. So blues is walking with me."
From the final moments of the track, ending the album.
"The body of Shane Fenton is in the laundry chute of the New Ambassadors Hotel near Euston Station "
Normal lyrics include "Get thee behind me Stryper, I’ve played your records backwards, I’ve seen your antics in the Green Room"
"Your pain on the cross was but a splinter compared to the agony of my father. I will drive deeper the thorns into your rancid carcass, you profaner of Isis.You have done nothing."
Reversed lyrics from earlier in the song.
"Thursday Night we smoked indica, and Azwethinkweizm was born"
"Obey your parents. Do your homework. Winners don't do drugs."

Heard between the songs "Are Friends Electric" and "Ozar Midrashim." The back of the album cover features the disclaimer "InSoc can accept no responsibility for the mental effect of the backwards message."
"Fuck the Devil! Fuck that shit! We believe in life legit. If you diggin' what we say, why you throw your soul away?"
Heard after "licked the back of his neck and said.."
"Yeah, if you flip this message cuz you think there's some secret message, there ain't shit!"
"只有你能聽得到" ("Only you can hear it")
Following the same line forwards. This is done intentionally, so if you play it backwards, "only you can hear it".
"It doesn't take a genius to tell the difference between chicken shit and chicken salad."
Disguised as a foreign-sounding language spoken under the narration.
The song title is backmasked in the opening 30 seconds of the song.
"In the dead of the night, love bites"

The introduction to the song features amplifier feedback along the message "Ladies and Gentlemen, from Boise, Idaho... direct from the Paramount Theatre... 12 year-old, little Billy Corgan" with the last word, "Corgan", being backmasked.
Can be heard spoken repeatedly throughout the chorus.
"All beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions on a sesame seed bun. Two all beef patties. (laugh)"
"I don't know what to do, no guilt is in my heart, I don't know what to do, I'm not the reason"
The backwards message is the chorus of the song.
"Everything falls apart even the people who never frown eventually break down. Everything has to end you'll soon find we're out of time left to watch it all unwind."
"You should brush your teeth, and you should wash your hands."
The only lyric to this interlude. Heard once at around 0:25 to 0:35, and four times from 1:45 to end. The title is reversed because you have to reverse the song as well to get the message from it.
"This is my lowest point of vulnerability"
At the opening of the track.

Various messages. For example, "You are on the other side now...there ain't no going back once you been here, brothers and sisters...there ain't no going back." says the same thing forward as it does backwards "uh uh the apocoloypse"

"Have mommy or daddy ever had to spank you?", "I'm very fond of this one about an old spider friend of mine", "The itsy bitsy spider climbed up the water spout / down came the rain and washed the spider out / out came the sun and dried up all the rain / and the itsy bitsy spider climbed up the spout again."

"Good day, I'm Bob McKenzie. This is my brother, Doug." "Take off!" "No, how's it goin'?" "Oh, sorry, eh." "No, you take off!" "You take off!" "You blew it!" "Oh, sorry." "This is the backwards part." "Alright, start over." "Forget it!"
The entire song played backwards reveals another song titled "Nervous".

"Respect your parents." / "Clean your room." / "Do your homework." / "Don't stay out too late." / "Eat your vegetables." / "Put away your toys." / "Don't sit too close to the TV." / "Take the dog for a nice walk." / "Hurry up! Get dressed for church." / "Who needs me to suck their dick?" / (at the end of the song) "Don't listen to this song."

Clearly audible reversed speech by singer Jimmy Urine; starts at 2:10 into the song and lasts until the end. The song speaks degradingly about angsty teenagers who look for backwards messages in music, and contains the lyrics "Play that record backwards/ Here's a message yo for the suckas/ Play that record backwards/ And go fuck yourself."

"Now tell me, about your miserable little lives. I do not subscribe to your superstitious, narrow minded flights* of paranoia. I and people like me, will always prevail! You will never stifle* our free speech in any country in the world, 'coz we will fight forever*." "In a single stroke, you poor, stupid, running dogs. Why is it..." [Words followed by a * are difficult to make out, and may be incorrect]
"Rotting from the inside / over-incubated by the heat of fear and love / the self's coagula[ted]"

"Oh My God! Descending to the 13th floor, 14, 16, We’re on the 11th floor, descending to the 12th floor Oh My God! Descending to the 13th floor, 14, 16, We’re on the 11th floor, descending to the 12th floor"
Occurs at the very end of the song, after the breakdown. The message is more noticeable on the a cappella version of the song.
"Seven, seven, seven. I am the bringer of the end, fear me, I am the beast that is technology."
Occurs at 4:43. There is a recurring theme in Nevermore albums about humanity becoming enslaved by technology.
"All my people right here, right now... d'you know what I mean? Yeah, yeah..."
Heard throughout some parts of the song, including the third verse.

"Just once or twice is good for your soul / Praise God! Brothers and sisters! / Accept Jesus into your heart and you will saved! / You will receive everlasting life / Listen to me, I've sinned, I know / Praise Jesus and you will be saved, saved, saved / Praise God, you are healed, healed, healed."
"What are you looking for the devil for, when you ought to be looking for the Lord?"
A response to the backmasking controversy.
Said in a high-pitched voice. The title, "Renholdër", is "Re: D. Lohner" backwards. Danny Lohner was an early member of A Perfect Circle.
"Oh, oh, oh / It's magic, you know / Never believe it's not so / Och aye! / Oh, oh, oh / It's magic..."

"Hello, Luka. Congratulations. You've just discovered the secret message. Please send your answer to Old Pink, care of the funny farm, Chalfont." (voice in background) "Roger! Carolyne is on the phone!" "Ok"
"The brainwashed do not know they are being brainwashed"
After the song "The Damned", at the end of the album.
"Hello, how are you? I'm fine. 'Cause I know that the Lord is coming soon. Coming, coming soon", followed by thirty-seven "hah"s.
At the end of the track with the sound of rain and wind. The message is in sharp contrast to the rest of the sexually laden song.
Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope
Backmasked at the end of the song. it could be there's "something" with Japanese. They also released bonus track (Scurrilous Japan Edition only) "To Porter With Love".
Found prior to the bridge at around 1:13. As The Rutles are themselves a parody of The Beatles, this parodies the numerous purported backwards messages in Beatles songs.
"Look at me / I'm a coward too / You don't need to hide, my friend / For I am just like you"
This reversed lyrics form the first two identical "verses" of the song, then are sung forwards in the final verse before the end.
"Join us!" (x45) followed by "Welcome back" as a greeting to their fans for their 2nd record.
Whispered (steadily getting louder) during the first 1 minute and 5 seconds of the song
Throughout the song. Obviously parodies the claimed Satanic messages.

"I've traveled many roads and seen many things in search of fortune and fame. All my dreams died no matter how hard I tried so nothing but unhappiness remains. So now I sit with this pen in my hand, itching to produce and perform. Waiting to rule with absolute power. I love these calm little moments before the storm."
This message appears at the beginning of the track.
This plays at the end of Karate, before the song "Rock Your Socks" begins.
"Yeah, you should definitely have a suck of this." "Yeah." "Yeah. Put it in your mouth!" "Stick it in your nose." "Wow, look at that kite." "I hate kites." "See those kites?"

After the first verse, at around 0:36. Never Die was a song on the band's first LP, and "Tiger Army Never Die" has since become the band's motto. The title of Tiger Army's third release, III: Ghost Tigers Rise was taken from this message as well.
"Listen to your mother. Your father is right. Work hard. Stay in school. Listen to your mother. Your father is right. Listen to your mother. Your father is right."
Occurs during indecipherable whispering and ambiance beginning at 0:59.
"You never listened, won't you turn this back around."
Happiness is a warm gun, yes it is
An extended message, beginning with "There is a god; the universe is not without a creator, sustainer and protector. He is the ocean of bliss."
"Be nice to your mom and dad. Don't abuse. Don't blow your brains out on drugs. Rock your brains out! By the way, you're ruining your needle!"
Hidden track at end of song.
"Now I lay me down to sleep" / "I pray the Lord my soul to keep" / "If I should die before I wake" / "I pray the Lord my soul to take"
"Wow, you must have an awful lot of free time on your hands."
At around 3:40. The message is an intentional satire of the Satanic backmasking controversy.
"Better look around before you say you don't care, / Shut your fucking mouth about the length of my hair, / How would you survive / If you were alive, / Shitty little person?"

Various messages, including "I am the heaven / I am the water / Ich bin deine Ritze / Ich bin deine Ritze und Schlitze", "You're a lonely little girl / But your Mommy & your Daddy don't care", "I'm like reach / I'm like squat / I'm like roll / Repeat / Like roll over / Like thrust / Okay, like pull / Like push / I'm like . . . / Okay, like . . . blow / I'm blow", "You're never too old", and "Ich bin hier / Und du bist mein Sofa"
